extension.searchTitle: To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide grants to States to streamline State requirements and procedures for veterans with military emergency medical training to become civilian emergency medical technicians.; Veteran Emergency Medical Technician Support Act of 2016;H.R. 1818 (RH)

titleInfo.title: To amend the Public Health Service Act to provide grants to States to streamline State requirements and procedures for veterans with military emergency medical training to become civilian emergency medical technicians.
Veteran Emergency Medical Technician Support Act of 2016

extension.shortTitle: Veteran Emergency Medical Technician Support Act of 2016
extension.action: Mr. Kinzinger of Illinois (for himself and Mrs. Capps) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

Additional sponsors: Mrs. Blackburn, Mr. Cohen, Ms. Titus, Mr. Marino, Mr. Burgess, Mr. Costello of Pennsylvania, Mr. Murphy of Pennsylvania, Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois, Mr. Butterfield, Mr. Hultgren, Mr. Hanna, Mr. Rangel, Mr. Farenthold, Ms. Slaughter, Ms. Schakowsky, Mr. Pocan, Mr. Gibson, Ms. Esty, Mr. Quigley, Mr. Carter of Texas, Mr. Mooney of West Virginia, Ms. Norton, Ms. Judy Chu of California, Mr. Latta, Ms. Clark of Massachusetts, Mr. Walz, Mr. McGovern, Mr. Blumenauer, Mr. Johnson of Ohio, Mr. Nugent, Ms. Stefanik, Mr. Stivers, Mr. Hurd of Texas, Mrs. Kirkpatrick, Ms. Jenkins of Kansas, Ms. McSally, Mr. Price of North Carolina, Mr. Walberg, Mr. Katko, Mr. Kilmer, Mr. Cole, Mrs. Comstock, Mr. Frelinghuysen, Mr. Boustany, Mr. Perlmutter, Mr. Massie, Mr. Takai, Mr. Bucshon, Mr. Coffman, Mr. Peters, Mr. Calvert, Mrs. Napolitano, Mr. Yoder, Mr. Smith of Texas, Mr. DesJarlais, Mr. Luetkemeyer, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Ruiz, Mr. Loebsack, Mr. Sensenbrenner, Mr. Abraham, Mr. Jenkins of West Virginia, Mr. Tipton, Mr. Young of Iowa, Miss Rice of New York, Mr. Pompeo, Mr. Heck of Nevada, Mr. Rokita, Mr. Neal, Mrs. Brooks of Indiana, Mrs. Wagner, Mr. Paulsen, and Mr. Turner
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
